Class Restaurant

java.lang.Object
Restaurant
public class Restaurant extends Object
Represents a restaurant management system that handles employee information, menu items, and basic restaurant operations.

This class provides functionality to: - Manage restaurant employees (add, remove, update) - Manage dishes (add, remove, update) - Calculate payroll information - Track restaurant operational status (open late hours)

Internally, it uses ArrayList collections to store employees and dishes, allowing for dynamic sizing and fast access.

Since:
2024

  • Constructor Details

    • Restaurant

      public Restaurant(String name)
      Constructs a new Restaurant object with the specified name. Initializes empty lists for employees and dishes. Sets the default late-hours flag to false.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the restaurant (must not be null or empty)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the name is null or blank

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Gets the name of the restaurant.
      Returns:
      the restaurant name

    • isOpenLate

      public boolean isOpenLate()
      Checks if the restaurant is open late.
      Returns:
      true if open late; false otherwise

    • setOpenLate

      public void setOpenLate(boolean openLate)
      Sets the restaurant's late-night open status.
      Parameters:
      openLate - true to mark the restaurant as open late; false otherwise

    • addEmployee

      public String addEmployee(String name, double hourlyRate, double hoursWorked)
      Adds a new employee to the restaurant after validating input and checking for duplicates.
      Parameters:
      name - the employee's name (non-null, non-empty)
      hourlyRate - the employee's hourly rate (must be positive)
      hoursWorked - the number of hours worked (must be non-negative)
      Returns:
      null if added successfully, or a validation error message

    • removeEmployee

      public String removeEmployee(String name)
      Removes an employee by their name (case-insensitive).
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the employee to remove
      Returns:
      status message indicating success or failure

    • updateEmployee

      public String updateEmployee(String name, double newRate, double newHours)
      Updates an existing employee's hourly rate and hours worked.
      Parameters:
      name - the employee's name to update
      newRate - the new hourly rate to apply
      newHours - the new hours worked to apply
      Returns:
      status message indicating result of update attempt

    • getEmployeeDisplayStrings

      public List<String> getEmployeeDisplayStrings()
      Returns formatted string representations for all employees.

      Each string includes the employee's name, hourly rate, and hours worked, as returned by the getDisplayString() method of the Employee class.

      Returns:
      a list of formatted display strings for each employee

    • addDish

      public String addDish(String name, double price)
      Adds a new dish to the restaurant menu after validating input and checking for duplicates.
      Parameters:
      name - the dish name (must not be null or empty)
      price - the price of the dish (must be non-negative)
      Returns:
      null if added successfully, or a validation error message

    • removeDish

      public String removeDish(String name)

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      status message indicating result

    • getEmployees

      public List<Employee> getEmployees()

      public List<Dish> getDishes()
      Returns a **copy** of the current in-memory dishes list so callers can iterate without mutating our internal list.

    • removeEmployeeById

      public boolean removeEmployeeById(int id)
      Removes the first employee whose database‐ID matches the given id.
      Parameters:
      id - the database ID to remove
      Returns:
      true if an employee was found invalid input: '&' removed, false otherwise

    • removeDishById

      Returns:
